post.content_html:
Only a few days remain until we witness sixteen great CS:GO teams competing at two BLAST Premier Spring Showdown tournaments: European & American. Letâ€™s find out the details about participating teams, dates, and where to watch upcoming matches.

Both tournaments will be held online from March 29th to April 2nd. In each, eight teams will be fighting for a $67,500 prize pool and a ticket to the Blast Premier Spring Final 2023.

Here is the list of the teams that will play in the European tournament :

Of all these teams, only fnatic received a direct invitation to participate in the Showdown. OG, BIG, and Ninjas in Pyjamas qualified for the event due to their results in Januaryâ€™s BLAST Premier Spring Groups 2023.

Cloud9 and 9INE qualified for the Showdown by winning RES Eastern & Western European Masters Spring. Rare Atom won 5E Arena Asian Cup Spring, and Copenhagen Flames won Pelaajat Nordic Masters to get here.

These are the teams that will participate in the American tournament :

Unlike in the European tournament, three teams were invited directly to the American one, and three more got their spot based on their results in Spring Groups. FURIA, MIBR, and paiN received an invite from BLAST, whilst Complexity, Liquid, and EG qualified from Spring Groups.

Imperial secured their spot at the American Spring Showdown by winning TG Masters Spring, and Nouns qualified by placing first at the Ace North American Masters Spring.

The format of both tournaments is Single Elimination, meaning there will be no Group Stage and no Lower Bracket.

Prize pool distribution for both European and American Showdown events is the same.

  • 1st â€“ $20,000 + Spot at the Spring Final
  • 2nd â€“ $12,500
  • 3rd-4th â€“ $7,500
  • 5th-8th â€“ $5,000

The winners of the Showdown events will qualify for the BLAST Premier Spring Final. This tournament has a prize pool of $425,000, and it will happen in June in Washington, D.C., USA.

You will be able to watch the Showdown matches live on BLAST.tv , BLAST Premier YouTube channel , or their Twitch channel . There might also be watch parties held by content creators on Twitch, so browse the platform to find one.

You do not want to miss BLAST Premier Showdown, trust us. Big chances it will be one of the last CS:GO tournaments since Counter-Strike 2 is coming this summer, so cheer for your favorite teams and enjoy the action.
